snmp.iupwAlrtTxt: Initial user password must have at least 8 characters.
snmp.httpssnmpv3AlrtTxt: HTTPS must be enabled for administrator before SNMP v3 can be enabled.
snmp.saveTrapNotsnmpv1v2Alrt: To enable traps SNMP v1 and/or v2c must be enabled.
snmp.saveTrapIpLengthAlrt: An IP address must be specified for traps.
snmp.saveTrapIpIpv6Alrt: IP address specified is neither a correct IPv4 nor a correct IPv6 address.
snmp.saveTrapIpAlrt: IP address specified is not a correct IPv4 address.
snmp.trapsSnmpV3Alrt: 'SNMP v3' and 'Traps for SNMP v1/v2c' can not be enabled at the same time.
snmp.hlpTxt: Click here for help on this page
snmp.trapColdStartExplTxt: Sent when the camera is starting up.
snmp.trapWarmStartExplTxt: Sent when SNMP, not the camera, is starting up.
snmp.trapLinkUpExplTxt: Sent when the link goes from down to up.
snmp.trapAuthFailExplTxt: Sent when when an authentication has failed.
snmp.iniPwSetTxt: SNMP v3 initial user password has been set.
snmp.note2Txt: Inital user password is activated only when HTTPS is enabled and can only be set once.
snmp.note3Txt: If SNMP v3 is enabled, then SNMP v1/v2c traps should be disabled.
